intro: Ericameria monactis, commonly known as the yellow snakeweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky plains. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Ericameria monactis is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
